it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket

Class Socket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Socket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ip4Socket, Ip6Socket, RawIpSocket, RawLinkSocket

    public class Socket
extends java.lang.Object
    Unix socket. It wraps the standard C Unix socket interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Socket

        public Socket(int domain,
              int type,
              int protocol)
        Creates a new socket.
        Parameters:
        domain - specifies a communication domain; this selects the protocol family which will be used for communication
        type - specifies the communication semantics
        protocol - specifies a particular protocol to be used with the socket. If only a single protocol exists for a particular socket type, it can be specified as 0

    • Method Detail

      • setDebug

        public static void setDebug(boolean enable)
        Sets debug mode. In debug mode, debug messages are printed on standard output.
        Parameters:
        enable - true for enabling debug mode; false for disabling debug mode

        Gets the socket domain.

        public void close()
        Closes the socket.

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Binds the socket to all local addresses.

      • bind

        public void bind(IpAddress addr,
                 int port)
        Binds the socket to the selected IP address and port.
        Parameters:
        addr - the IP address
        port - the port number

      • bind

        public void bind(EthAddress addr)
          throws java.net.SocketException
        Binds the socket to the selected Ethernet address.
        Parameters:
        addr - the Ethernet address
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException

      • send

        public void send(DataPacket pkt)
        Sends a packet.
        Parameters:
        pkt - the packet to be sent

      • sendto

        public int sendto(byte[] buf,
                  int off,
                  int len,
                  int flags,
                  java.lang.String dest_addr,
                  int dest_port)
        Sends a raw data.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer containing the packet. Whether the buffer should include also the packet header or not, depends on the type of socket, protocol, and configured options
        off - the offset within the buffer
        len - the data length
        flags - flags (if any)
        dest_addr - the destination address
        dest_port - the destination port (if applicable)
        Returns:
        the number of characters sent, in case of success; -1 on error

      • receive

        public void receive(DataPacket pkt)
        Receives a packet.

        This method is blocking, that is it returns only when a packet is received.

        Parameters:
        pkt - the packet used for returning the incoming packet

      • recv

        public int recv(byte[] buf,
                int off,
                int flags)
        receives raw data.

        This method is blocking, that is it returns only when a packet is received.

        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer used for returning the entire received packet
        off - the offset within the buffer
        flags - flags (if any)
        Returns:
        the length of the received packet

      • recvfrom

        public int recvfrom(byte[] buf,
                    int off,
                    int flags,
                    byte[] addr,
                    byte[] port)
        receives raw data with source socket address.

        This method is blocking, that is it returns only when a packet is received.

        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer used for returning the entire received packet
        off - the offset within the buffer
        flags - flags (if any)
        addr - the buffer used for returning the source address
        port - the buffer used for returning the source port
        Returns:
        the length of the received packet

      • setsockopt

        public int setsockopt(int level,
                      int optname,
                      byte[] optval,
                      int off,
                      int len)
        Sets a given socket option.
        Parameters:
        level - the option level
        optname - the option number
        optval - the buffer containing the option
        off - the offset within the buffer
        len - the length of the option
        Returns:
        zero on success; -1 on error

      • getsockopt

        public int getsockopt(int level,
                      int optname,
                      byte[] optval,
                      int off)
        Gets a given socket option.
        Parameters:
        level - the option level
        optname - the option number
        optval - the buffer used to return the option
        off - the offset within the buffer
        Returns:
        the length of the option on success, -1 on error (Note: differently, the original unix getsockopt() method returns zero on success; -1 on error; the option length is returned within an extra parameter)
